Events.html: 1060 – Béla I is crowned king of Hungary.
Events.text: Béla I is crowned king of Hungary.

links.subject: Hungary
links.title: Kingdom of Hungary in the Middle Ages

Events.html: 1240 – Mongol invasion of Rus': Kiev under Danylo of Halych and Voivode Dmytro falls to the Mongols under Batu Khan.
Events.text: Mongol invasion of Rus': Kiev under Danylo of Halych and Voivode Dmytro falls to the Mongols under Batu Khan.

Events.html: 1534 – The city of Quito in Ecuador is founded by Spanish settlers led by Sebastián de Belalcázar.
Events.text: The city of Quito in Ecuador is founded by Spanish settlers led by Sebastián de Belalcázar.

Events.html: 1648 – Colonel Thomas Pride of the New Model Army purges the Long Parliament of MPs sympathetic to King Charles I of England, in order for the King's trial to go ahead; came to be known as "Pride's Purge".
Events.text: Colonel Thomas Pride of the New Model Army purges the Long Parliament of MPs sympathetic to King Charles I of England, in order for the King's trial to go ahead; came to be known as "Pride's Purge".

Events.html: 1704 – Battle of Chamkaur: During the Mughal-Sikh Wars, an outnumbered Sikh Khalsa defeats a Mughal army.
Events.text: Battle of Chamkaur: During the Mughal-Sikh Wars, an outnumbered Sikh Khalsa defeats a Mughal army.

Events.html: 1745 – Charles Edward Stuart's army begins retreat during the second Jacobite Rising.
Events.text: Charles Edward Stuart's army begins retreat during the second Jacobite Rising.

Events.html: 1768 – The first edition of the Encyclopædia Britannica is published.
Events.text: The first edition of the Encyclopædia Britannica is published.

Events.html: 1790 – The U.S. Congress moves from New York City to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
Events.text: The U.S. Congress moves from New York City to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

Events.html: 1865 – The Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution is ratified, banning slavery.
Events.text: The Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution is ratified, banning slavery.

links.subject: Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution
links.title: Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution

Events.html: 1877 – The first edition of the Washington Post is published.
Events.text: The first edition of the Washington Post is published.

Events.html: 1884 – The Washington Monument in Washington, D.C., is completed.
Events.text: The Washington Monument in Washington, D.C., is completed.

Events.html: 1897 – London becomes the world's first city to host licensed taxicabs.
Events.text: London becomes the world's first city to host licensed taxicabs.

Events.html: 1904 – Theodore Roosevelt articulated his "Corollary" to the Monroe Doctrine, stating that the U.S. would intervene in the Western Hemisphere should Latin American governments prove incapable or unstable.
Events.text: Theodore Roosevelt articulated his "Corollary" to the Monroe Doctrine, stating that the U.S. would intervene in the Western Hemisphere should Latin American governments prove incapable or unstable.

Events.html: 1907 – A coal mine explosion at Monongah, West Virginia, kills 362 workers.
Events.text: A coal mine explosion at Monongah, West Virginia, kills 362 workers.

Events.html: 1916 – World War I: The Central Powers capture Bucharest.
Events.text: World War I: The Central Powers capture Bucharest.

Events.html: 1917 – Finland declares independence from Russia.
Events.text: Finland declares independence from Russia.

Events.html: 1917 – Halifax Explosion: A munitions explosion near Halifax, Nova Scotia kills more than 1,900 people in the largest artificial explosion up to that time.
Events.text: Halifax Explosion: A munitions explosion near Halifax, Nova Scotia kills more than 1,900 people in the largest artificial explosion up to that time.

links.subject: largest artificial explosion up to that time
links.title: Largest artificial non-nuclear explosions

Events.html: 1917 – World War I: USS Jacob Jones is the first American destroyer to be sunk by enemy action when it is torpedoed by German submarine SM U-53.
Events.text: World War I: USS Jacob Jones is the first American destroyer to be sunk by enemy action when it is torpedoed by German submarine SM U-53.

Events.html: 1921 – The Anglo-Irish Treaty is signed in London by British and Irish representatives.
Events.text: The Anglo-Irish Treaty is signed in London by British and Irish representatives.

Events.html: 1922 – One year to the day after the signing of the Anglo-Irish Treaty, the Irish Free State comes into existence.
Events.text: One year to the day after the signing of the Anglo-Irish Treaty, the Irish Free State comes into existence.

Events.html: 1928 – The government of Colombia sends military forces to suppress a month-long strike by United Fruit Company workers, resulting in an unknown number of deaths.
Events.text: The government of Colombia sends military forces to suppress a month-long strike by United Fruit Company workers, resulting in an unknown number of deaths.

Events.html: 1933 – U.S. federal judge John M. Woolsey rules that James Joyce's novel Ulysses is not obscene.
Events.text: U.S. federal judge John M. Woolsey rules that James Joyce's novel Ulysses is not obscene.

Events.html: 1941 – World War II: The United Kingdom and Canada declare war on Finland in support of the Soviet Union during the Continuation War.
Events.text: World War II: The United Kingdom and Canada declare war on Finland in support of the Soviet Union during the Continuation War.

Events.html: 1947 – The Everglades National Park in Florida is dedicated.
Events.text: The Everglades National Park in Florida is dedicated.

Events.html: 1953 – Vladimir Nabokov completes his controversial novel Lolita.
Events.text: Vladimir Nabokov completes his controversial novel Lolita.

Events.html: 1956 – A violent water polo match between Hungary and the USSR takes place during the 1956 Summer Olympics in Melbourne, against the backdrop of the 1956 Hungarian Revolution.
Events.text: A violent water polo match between Hungary and the USSR takes place during the 1956 Summer Olympics in Melbourne, against the backdrop of the 1956 Hungarian Revolution.

Events.html: 1957 – Project Vanguard: A launchpad explosion of Vanguard TV3 thwarts the first United States attempt to launch a satellite into Earth orbit.
Events.text: Project Vanguard: A launchpad explosion of Vanguard TV3 thwarts the first United States attempt to launch a satellite into Earth orbit.

Events.html: 1967 – Adrian Kantrowitz performs the first human heart transplant in the United States.
Events.text: Adrian Kantrowitz performs the first human heart transplant in the United States.

Events.html: 1969 – Meredith Hunter is killed by Hells Angels during a Rolling Stones concert at the Altamont Speedway in California.
Events.text: Meredith Hunter is killed by Hells Angels during a Rolling Stones concert at the Altamont Speedway in California.

Events.html: 1971 – Pakistan severs diplomatic relations with India following New Delhi's recognition of Bangladesh.
Events.text: Pakistan severs diplomatic relations with India following New Delhi's recognition of Bangladesh.

Events.html: 1973 – The Twenty-fifth Amendment: The United States House of Representatives votes 387 to 35 to confirm Gerald Ford as Vice President of the United States. (On November 27, the Senate confirmed him 92 to 3.)
Events.text: The Twenty-fifth Amendment: The United States House of Representatives votes 387 to 35 to confirm Gerald Ford as Vice President of the United States. (On November 27, the Senate confirmed him 92 to 3.)

links.subject: The Twenty-fifth Amendment
links.title: Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution

links.subject: Vice President of the United States
links.title: Vice President of the United States

Events.html: 1975 – The Troubles: Fleeing from the police, a Provisional IRA unit takes a couple hostage in Balcombe Street, London, beginning a six-day siege.
Events.text: The Troubles: Fleeing from the police, a Provisional IRA unit takes a couple hostage in Balcombe Street, London, beginning a six-day siege.

Events.html: 1977 – South Africa grants independence to Bophuthatswana, although it is not recognized by any other country.
Events.text: South Africa grants independence to Bophuthatswana, although it is not recognized by any other country.

Events.html: 1978 – Spain approves its latest constitution in a referendum.
Events.text: Spain approves its latest constitution in a referendum.

Events.html: 1982 – The Troubles: The Irish National Liberation Army bombed a pub frequented by British soldiers in Ballykelly, Northern Ireland. It killed eleven soldiers and six civilians.
Events.text: The Troubles: The Irish National Liberation Army bombed a pub frequented by British soldiers in Ballykelly, Northern Ireland. It killed eleven soldiers and six civilians.

Events.html: 1988 – The Australian Capital Territory is granted self-government.
Events.text: The Australian Capital Territory is granted self-government.

links.subject: Australian Capital Territory
links.title: History of the Australian Capital Territory

Events.html: 1989 – The École Polytechnique massacre (or Montreal Massacre): Marc Lépine, an anti-feminist gunman, murders 14 young women at the École Polytechnique in Montreal.
Events.text: The École Polytechnique massacre (or Montreal Massacre): Marc Lépine, an anti-feminist gunman, murders 14 young women at the École Polytechnique in Montreal.

Events.html: 1991 – In Croatia, forces of the Yugoslav People's Army bombard Dubrovnik after laying siege to the city since May.
Events.text: In Croatia, forces of the Yugoslav People's Army bombard Dubrovnik after laying siege to the city since May.

Events.html: 1992 – The Babri Mosque in Ayodhya, India, is demolished, leading to widespread riots causing the death of over 1,500 people.
Events.text: The Babri Mosque in Ayodhya, India, is demolished, leading to widespread riots causing the death of over 1,500 people.

Events.html: 1997 – A Russian Antonov An-124 cargo plane crashes into an apartment complex near Irkutsk, Siberia, killing 67.
Events.text: A Russian Antonov An-124 cargo plane crashes into an apartment complex near Irkutsk, Siberia, killing 67.

Events.html: 2005 – Several villagers are shot dead during protests in Dongzhou, China.
Events.text: Several villagers are shot dead during protests in Dongzhou, China.

Events.html: 2005 – An Iranian Air Force C-130 military transport aircraft crashes into a ten-floor apartment building in a residential area of Tehran, killing all 84 on board and 44 more on the ground.
Events.text: An Iranian Air Force C-130 military transport aircraft crashes into a ten-floor apartment building in a residential area of Tehran, killing all 84 on board and 44 more on the ground.

links.subject: crashes into a ten-floor apartment building
links.title: 2005 Iranian Air Force C-130 crash

Events.html: 2006 – NASA reveals photographs taken by Mars Global Surveyor suggesting the presence of liquid water on Mars.
Events.text: NASA reveals photographs taken by Mars Global Surveyor suggesting the presence of liquid water on Mars.

Events.html: 2008 – The 2008 Greek riots break out upon the killing of a 15-year-old boy, Alexandros Grigoropoulos, by a police officer.
Events.text: The 2008 Greek riots break out upon the killing of a 15-year-old boy, Alexandros Grigoropoulos, by a police officer.
